channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Afghans from the alleged National Guard shooter's community worry about the future
item.description: A small community of Afghan immigrants have made Bellingham, Wash., their home. This is where the alleged National Guard shooter lived, leaving resettled Afghans to worry about the future.
item.content:encoded: A small community of Afghan immigrants have made Bellingham, Wash., their home. This is where the alleged National Guard shooter lived, leaving resettled Afghans to worry about the future.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: After Hurricane Helene, volunteers decide to get certified to help in disasters
item.description: Volunteer emergency responders give their time to train just in case they may be needed in a disaster. Meet some of those volunteer responders in our series Here to Help.
item.content:encoded: Volunteer emergency responders give their time to train just in case they may be needed in a disaster. Meet some of those volunteer responders in our series Here to Help.
item.dc:creator: Zachary Turner

item.title: Tropical storms and monsoon rains have wreaked havoc across Asia
item.description: Tropical storms and monsoon rains have wreaked havoc across Asia in the past week, with the death toll continuing to rise after extreme floods in large parts of Southeast Asia as well as Sri Lanka.
item.content:encoded: Tropical storms and monsoon rains have wreaked havoc across Asia in the past week, with the death toll continuing to rise after extreme floods in large parts of Southeast Asia as well as Sri Lanka.

item.title: Supreme Court lets Texas use gerrymandered map that could give GOP 5 more House seats
item.description: The Supreme Court has cleared the way for a Texas congressional map that may help the GOP win five more U.S. House seats in the 2026 midterms. A lower court found the map is likely unconstitutional.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court has cleared the way for a Texas congressional map that may help the GOP win five more U.S. House seats in the 2026 midterms. A lower court found the map is likely unconstitutional.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Minnesota responds to Trump rhetoric on Somali immigrants
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Katelyn Vue, a reporter from Sahan Journal, a news outlet focused on immigrants and people of color in Minnesota, about President Trump's attacks on Somali people.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Katelyn Vue, a reporter from Sahan Journal, a news outlet focused on immigrants and people of color in Minnesota, about President Trump's attacks on Somali people.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Hodges

item.title: Elephant seals remember their enemies
item.description: Elephant seals don't forget their enemies. We learn about the great beasts' big beefs and why they matter.
item.content:encoded: Elephant seals don't forget their enemies. We learn about the great beasts' big beefs and why they matter.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: FBI arrests suspect from Virginia in Jan. 6 pipe bomb attack
item.description: Federal authorities have arrested a Virginia man suspected of placing pipe bombs near the Capitol nearly five years ago, hours before a mob swarmed the building.
item.content:encoded: Federal authorities have arrested a Virginia man suspected of placing pipe bombs near the Capitol nearly five years ago, hours before a mob swarmed the building.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Depression is common among police. One cop found relief on the comedy stage
item.description: Depression and other mental health issues affect millions of Americans. Police are especially vulnerable, due to the stresses of the job. One officer in Colorado found an outlet doing standup comedy.
item.content:encoded: Depression and other mental health issues affect millions of Americans. Police are especially vulnerable, due to the stresses of the job. One officer in Colorado found an outlet doing standup comedy.
item.dc:creator: Lakshmi Singh

item.title: Remembering Steve Cropper, guitarist and member of Stax Records' Booker T & the M.G.'s
item.description: Steve Cropper, the Booker T. & the MG guitarist, songwriter and producer who was instrumental in the rise of R&B powerhouse Stax Records, died in Nashville at 84.
item.content:encoded: Steve Cropper, the Booker T. & the MG guitarist, songwriter and producer who was instrumental in the rise of R&B powerhouse Stax Records, died in Nashville at 84.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Signalgate, Venezuala and what's happening at the Pentagon
item.description: What's going on at the Pentagon and what does it mean for Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth? NPR's Mary Louise Kelly, Tom Bowman and Quil Lawrence break it down in this excerpt from Sources & Methods.
item.content:encoded: What's going on at the Pentagon and what does it mean for Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth? NPR's Mary Louise Kelly, Tom Bowman and Quil Lawrence break it down in this excerpt from Sources & Methods.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly
